events.message: The insured reported a two-car collision that occurred at an intersection, filing the initial claim for damages to the vehicle.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision reported by the customer.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the claimant’s case and manage further communications.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and provided reference details to the claimant.
Requested copies of the police report, vehicle repair estimates, and photographs of the accident scene for verification.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including accident photos, official police report, and repair quotes.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and interviewing involved parties to assess liability.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault, and the damage assessment was finalized.
A settlement offer was made based on the evaluated repair costs and policy coverage limits.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the speed of claim processing and the settlement offer received.
Final approval was granted for the repair payment following customer agreement of the settlement terms.
The insurance payment for vehicle repairs was issued to the customer’s designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all payments were received and repairs were completed.
The insurer archived all documentation and reports related to the auto accident claim for future reference.
